messages.subject: thanks and vaccinations
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks to everyone for the great advice and support. I think keeping a journal daily to help me realize how much learning is really going on is a great idea. I
messages.messageBody:
Thanks to everyone for the great advice and support. I think keeping a
journal daily to help me realize how much learning is really going on is a
great idea. I am really looking forward to being part of this wonderful
communication web. Thanks again.


I began questioning vaccinations when they began giving newborn babies
the Hepatitis B vaccine. When I questioned the nurse on this her reply was,
"We need to start protecting our children now so that when they become
teenagers and begin to act irresponsibly they will be protected." I found
this insane since it is only transferred by blood or sexual contact.
Wouldn't it seem to make more sense to have faith in our children and our
guidance as parents to teach them about risks and moral responsibility?
There is also no long term safety tests on this vaccine. I felt it made no
sense to put this into my beautiful newborn babies body whose only defense
was the antibodies from my milk. None of my children are vaccinated.

Check out this sit if you get a chance:
www.nextcity.com/contents/summer99/16shots.html It is a great article on the
history of vaccinations.

If anyone has a son or daughter looking for a penpal, my sons
would greatly appreciate it. My 10 year old can be reached at
ashtonjaymz@.... My 7 year old son can be reached at
givenzane@....

Sincerely,
Robyn
